policies.title: Management of Technical Vulnerabilities
policies.policy_text: The organization shall establish, implement, and maintain a technical vulnerability management process to identify, assess, and remediate vulnerabilities in information systems. All systems and applications must be regularly scanned for vulnerabilities using multiple tools including SAST, SCA, and DAST. Vulnerabilities must be classified by severity (CRITICAL, HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW) and remediated within defined SLAs: CRITICAL within 24 hours, HIGH within 7 days, MEDIUM within 30 days, LOW within 90 days. Third-party components must be continuously monitored for new vulnerabilities. An inventory of all systems and their vulnerability status must be maintained. Exception processes must require formal risk acceptance by management. Post-remediation verification must confirm fixes without introducing new issues.

policies.title: Application Security Requirements
policies.policy_text: The organization shall define and implement comprehensive security requirements throughout the application development lifecycle. All applications must implement secure coding standards including input validation, output encoding, and parameterized queries to prevent injection attacks. Security requirements must be identified during the design phase and validated through testing. All user inputs must be validated against strict allow-lists. Database queries must use prepared statements or ORM methods. Output encoding must be applied based on context. Security testing including SAST, DAST, and manual code reviews must be mandatory before production deployment. Applications must implement error handling that does not expose sensitive information.

policies.title: Secure Development Lifecycle
policies.policy_text: The organization shall integrate security into all phases of the software development lifecycle. Security activities must be defined for requirements, design, development, testing, and deployment phases. Threat modeling must be conducted for major features. Security code review must be mandatory for all changes. Automated security testing must be integrated into CI/CD pipelines. Dependencies must be scanned before inclusion. Static and dynamic analysis results must achieve defined quality gates before production release. Security defects must be tracked and resolved before release. Development, test, and production environments must be segregated with appropriate access controls.

Vulnerable packages (express, jsonwebtoken) indicate inadequate SCA integration
Runtime vulnerabilities found by DAST suggest insufficient pre-deployment testing

policies.title: Protection against Malware
policies.policy_text: The organization shall implement controls to protect against malicious software including malware in third-party components. All software packages and dependencies must be scanned for known vulnerabilities before inclusion. A whitelist of approved libraries and versions must be maintained. Vulnerable components must be updated or replaced within defined timeframes. Software integrity must be verified using checksums or digital signatures. Malware scanning must be performed on all incoming software. Runtime application self-protection (RASP) should be considered for critical applications. Regular security assessments of the software supply chain must be conducted.

policies.title: Web Filtering
policies.policy_text: The organization shall implement controls to protect against web-based threats and attacks. All web applications must implement input validation and output encoding to prevent injection attacks. Security headers including Content Security Policy, X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, and HSTS must be configured. Web Application Firewall (WAF) must be deployed to provide defense-in-depth. Request rate limiting must prevent abuse. Parameterized queries must be used for all database operations. User-supplied content must be sanitized before display. Error handling must not expose sensitive information. Regular web penetration testing must validate security controls.
